dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Elon Musk's SpaceX just lost out on nearly $900 million in FCC subsidies for Starlink.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Elon Musk's SpaceX just lost out on nearly nine hundred dollars million in F C C subsidies for Starlink.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musks SpaceX won $885.5 million in subsidies from the Federal Communications Commission Monday to provide rural areas with high-speed internet through its Starlink satellite project, a major win for the Musk-led company and its first publicly announced major customer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? I thought they were a shoo-in for that rural internet funding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? I thought they were a shoo-in for that rural internet funding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, me too! But the FCC awarded it through a lottery system—SpaceX was actually one of the top bidders, but they didn't make the cut this time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, me too! But the F C C awarded it through a lottery system-SpaceX was actually one of the top bidders, but they didn't make the cut this time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: SpaceX was one of 180 companies who won a portion of FCC subsidies doled out via an auction to incentivize private companies to build out their networks in underserved areas of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And they were planning to serve, like, 600,000 locations across 30 states with that money, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. And they were planning to serve, like, six hundred thousand locations across thirty states with that money, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCC says the money will allow SpaceXs Starlink project to reach 35 states across 642,925 locations, while the only other satellite company to win subsidies in the auction, Maryland-based Hughes Network Systems, won $1.3 million serving 3,678 locations in one state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Meanwhile, Hughes Network Systems got $13 million for way fewer locations. Big contrast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Meanwhile, Hughes Network Systems got thirteen dollars million for way fewer locations. Big contrast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCC says the money will allow SpaceXs Starlink project to reach 35 states across 642,925 locations, while the only other satellite company to win subsidies in the auction, Maryland-based Hughes Network Systems, won $1.3 million serving 3,678 locations in one state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And this is SpaceX's first major public customer too—the U.S. government. That's gotta sting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is SpaceX's first major public customer too-the U.S. government. That's gotta sting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government is Starlinks first publicly-announced major customer, in addition to its partnership with Microsoft to provide its Azure cloud computing services over the network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. An expert from Quilty Analytics called it "terrible" for them—said it creates an unreliable revenue stream if they can't meet FCC standards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. An expert from Quilty Analytics called it terrible for them-said it creates an unreliable revenue stream if they can't meet F C C standards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is great for SpaceX because now they have an anchor customer, Quilty Analytics senior analyst Caleb Henry told CNBC. Up until this point SpaceX has not announced any major customers ... and [this auction] provides them an assured source of revenue that they can build on as long as they meet the FCCs criteria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is rough, especially during the pandemic, rural internet access is such a huge deal. Only 70% have decent broadband out there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is rough, especially during the pandemic, rural internet access is such a huge deal. Only seventy percent have decent broadband out there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At a time when work and school activities are being held online, only 77% of the population in rural areas of the U.S. have access to high-speed broadband internet, according to 2018 data from the FCC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now you've got Amazon's Project Kuiper and others jumping into low-orbit satellite internet too. The competition is heating up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now you've got Amazon's Project Kuiper and others jumping into low-orbit satellite internet too. The competition is heating up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A number of private companies are launching their own satellites into low-earth orbit in a bid to dominate the commercial space market, including Amazon with its satellite internet program Project Kuiper.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So SpaceX has to figure this out fast. 52,000 satellites planned? That's… ambitious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So SpaceX has to figure this out fast. fifty two thousand satellites planned? That's... ambitious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starlinks service is still nascentit only went into public beta over the summer with nearly 900 satellitesbut the company has ambitious plans to put 42,000 satellites into orbit for widespread high-speed internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Understatement. Let's see how they bounce back from this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Understatement. Let's see how they bounce back from this.
